member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.AdminConfigurationManagerBase
member.summary:
Base implementation of best practices for managing ConfigurationDomains and interacting with MFAdmin's configurator.
This base implementation can register/unregister root nodes at a given configuration extension point, corresponding to one of the .
Implementations of this class are responsible for:
- Creating and resolving references for nodes anywhere in the hierarchy so base methods know how to refer to nodes, and can resolve them easily using and ).
- Generating the correct s and s for MFAdmin to communicate back with the M-Files server using , , and .
- Ensuring requests from MFAdmin are received and routed back to this manager's
and methods as appropriate.

member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.ClientOperations
member.summary:
Provides a simple interface for updating the MFAdmin configuration interface.
Instances of this class are created by for node requests that can return proper responses. The appropriate node methods or custom command methods are then passed the instance so the MFAdmin interface can be informed of any changes made on the server.
Each client operation method generates one or more directives that are then passed back to MFAdmin at the end of the request.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.ClientOperations.Manager
member.summary: The manager responsible for the nodes that can be modified through this interface.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.ClientOperations.Context
member.summary: The context of the request that this interface will provide a response to.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.ClientOperations.DefaultNodeLocation
member.summary: The configuration domain node this response is for.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.ClientOperations.Directives
member.summary: The list of directives to be sent to the client as the response.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The manager for the nodes this object can do operations for.
The context of the request the operations will form a response to.

member.summary: Updates the default node's dashboard. Either completely, or a targeted section.
member.param: The content to update the dashboard with. If not specifed, the nodes own method is used to resolve the content.

member.summary: Forces the MFAdmin configurator to refresh it's metadata structure cache. It is wise to call this if a command has changes the metaddata structure of the vault. member.summary:
Refreshes information about the node. This allows for basic node information like DisplayName, Description and Priority to be updated, and also updates the nodes status and commands if those are supported.

member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.ConfigurationDomainNode
member.summary:
Represents a configuration domain node within the MFAdmin configurator.
This abstract base class makes it easier to implement in classes that can inherit from it, as only the methods corresponding to supported capabilities need to be defined.

member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.IConfigurationDomainNode
member.summary:
Represents a configuration domain node within the MFAdmin configurator that can be managed by an implementation.
The method is used to tell the manager which features a node supports and directly corresponds to which methods it can call. Most methods therefore do not need any real implementations.
For example, can simply throw a unless returns the flag.
Conversely though, even if a proper implementation is provided, it will not be used unless the corresponding flag is returned from .
The following methods must have real implementations: - - - - -

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.IConfigurationDomainNode.GetCapabilities
member.summary: Describes the capabilities this node has. The capabilities returned correspond to which interface methods are implemented/ok to call.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.IConfigurationDomainNode.GetID
member.summary: Provides the static id for the node. This value should at least be unique amongst siblings. IDs cannot have spaces, newlines or periods.

member.param: The context for the request.

member.summary: Provides a description of the domain. Currently displayed in the domain header area, and in some default dashboards.
member.param: The context for the request.

member.summary: Controls the order in which the node appears amongst siblings.

member.summary: Value should be the id of a domain command. Attribute should be used together with the attribute or the attribute. member.summary: Value should be the time in seconds between calls to a domain command. Attribute should be used together with the attribute. member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.Blocking
member.summary: Indicates whether the interface should be blocked while the command is being executed. Useful for longer running commands where further user interaction with the interface could negatively effect user experience or execution, or simply a way to indicate to the user that something is happening, and when it is over.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.Domain.ConfigurationDomainCommand.ExposeErrors
member.summary: Indicates whether errors should be exposed to the caller in JavaScript. - When true, any errors are not handled by the default handler... Instead they are allowed to bubble up through the promise chain. This allows them to be handled by non-default implementations. - When false, the default handler is used. This will show the message in a MFClientScript.IDashboard.ShowMessage() dialog.

Note: This is only used when the subscriber is filtered.

member.name: T:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.DynamicList.DynamicListRootAttribute

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.DynamicList.DynamicListRootAttribute.ListNames
member.summary: The property grid allows for each root list item to have a subtree, which have their own list to be handled independently of the top-most root list. Each EditableItem may declare itself as the context root item for one or more dynamic lists within the DynamicListRootAttribute -> ListNames as a new string[] { "ListForWhichThisItemIsTheRoot1", "ListForWhichThisItemIsTheRoot2" }

member.summary: Static helper values and methods for working with resources associated with the .

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.ResourceMarker.Id
member.summary: If a string starts with this value, it will be treated as a resource id.

member.name: F:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.ResourceMarker.Suffix
member.summary: If a string starts with this value, it will be treated end of a resource id. A ResourceIdPrefix value will be prepended to the value to get the resource id.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.ResourceMarker.ResolveText(System.String,System.String,System.Resources.ResourceManager)
member.summary: Detects if a string value is specified as a resource id, and if so, and a is defined, returns the resource value. If the value starts with "$$" the remaining portion of the string is used as the resource id. If the value starts with "$$$" the remaining portion of the string is appended to the resourceIdPrefix value, and then used as the resource id. If a ResourceManager isn't available, the original value will always be returned. If a ResourceManager is available and the value starts with "$$" and but no resource exists with the id, then null or an empty string is returned.
member.param: The raw string value which may be a literal or may refer to a resource.
The resource prefix value.
Manager that resources can be resolved from.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.ResourceMarker.GetResourceId(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a values resource id, if it contains a marker.
member.param: A raw string value which may be a literal or may refer to a resource.
The resource prefix value.
member.returns: A resource id if available, otherwise null.

member.summary: The generic name for the children of this type. If not specified, the un-namespaced child type editor name is used. Controls the default label for children (e.g. "{ChildName} [1]") and the add new button (e.g. "Add new {ChildName}").

member.summary: The human readable name to show for this value. If not specified, the member or type name will be shown.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.NameMember
member.summary: The member whose value can be used as a unique name for an instance of the type. Useful when displaying objects in a list (array).

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.DocReference
member.summary: A short text for the member or type so users understand it's purpose, how/when to use it, etc... May be displayed as a tool tip or in other context specific places.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.UsesAdapter
member.summary: Used in conjunction with an editor that is tagged as "IsAdapter = True". Members where the UsesAdapter = True / The items editor has IsAdapter = True are piped through the adapter for updates.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.Hidden
member.summary: Used to prevent a value/key from appearing in the editor. If specified on an object (complex type), none of it's children will be visible.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.HideWhen
member.summary:
Visibility condition. Via JSPath. When true, the value is hidden in the Editor.
Example: HideWhen = ".SiblingProperty == 'Test' " HideWhen = ".SiblingProperty{.NestedProperty == 'Test'} "

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.ShowWhen
member.summary:
Visibility condition. Via JSPath. When true, the value is shown in the Editor.
Example: ShowWhen = ".SiblingProperty == 'Test' " ShowWhen = ".SiblingProperty{.NestedProperty == 'Test'} "

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.Options

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.ClearOnCopy

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.RegExMask
member.summary: When provided, the regular expression mask will be enforced as a validation requirement.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.IsRequired
member.summary: Validation option. If this is set to true, and no value is specified, a validation message will be shown to the user.
member.remarks: This should be preferred almost always over DataMember::IsRequired = true, as that will cause deserialization to fail if the value is not specified.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.ForceLeafBehavior
member.summary: If set to true, forces an item in the configurators navigation tree (not the grid) to be rendered as a leaf node, preventing the items children from being shown in the tree. This option has no effect on an item that would already classify as a leaf.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonConfEditorAttribute.ForceChildLeafBehavior
member.summary: If set to true, forces the child items of an array in the configurators navigation tree (not the grid) to be rendered as a leaf node, preventing their children from being shown in the tree. This option has no effect on an item that would already classify as a leaf.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.JsonEditor.SchemaGenerator.GetLocalizedString(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Detects if a string value is specified as a resource id, and if so, and a is defined, returns the resource value. If the value starts with "$$" the remaining portion of the string is used as the resource id. If the value starts with "$$$" the remaining portion of the string is appended to the resourceIdPrefix value, and then used as the resource id. If a ResourceManager isn't available, the original value will always be returned. If a ResourceManager is available and the value starts with "$$" and but no resource exists with the id, then null or an empty string is returned.
member.param: The raw value.
The resource prefix value.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.SecureConfigurationManager`1.LoadRedactedText(MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.IConfigurationRequestContext)
member.summary: Loads the configuration text so that is safe to show in MFAdmin. All password fields will be redacted. As a safety precaution, this method Throws an exception if the configuration is not valid json, and user is not a sysadmin. This is the only way to ensure non-sysadmins do not see sensitive information.
member.param: The vault and user requesting the Configuration.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.SecureConfigurationManager`1.LoadRedactedText(MFilesAPI.Vault,MFiles.VAF.Configuration.SecurityAttribute.UserLevel)
member.summary: Loads the configuration text so that is safe to show in MFAdmin. All password fields will be redacted. As a safety precaution, this method Throws an exception if the configuration is not valid json, and user is not a sysadmin. This is the only way to ensure non-sysadmins do not see sensitive information.
member.param: The vault to load the configuration from.
The access level of the user requesting the configuration.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.SecureConfigurationManager`1.SaveRedactedText(MFiles.VAF.Configuration.AdminConfigurations.IConfigurationRequestContext,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a configuration text, ensuring that: 1. It is valid json (parseable). 2. No settings were modified that should be restricted for the current user. 3. Any passwords that were redacted when provided to the user, are restored first. If previous version cannot be parsed, no passwords would have been redacted, so this check isn't done, However, we would not have provided the unparseable text to vaultAdmins, so we don't allow them to save in this situation either.
member.param: The vault and user requesting the save.
The configuration text to save.

member.name: M:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.SecureConfigurationManager`1.SaveRedactedText(MFilesAPI.Vault,MFiles.VAF.Configuration.SecurityAttribute.UserLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a configuration text, ensuring that: 1. It is valid json (parseable). 2. No settings were modified that should be restricted for the current user. 3. Any passwords that were redacted when provided to the user, are restored first. If previous version cannot be parsed, no passwords would have been redacted, so this check isn't done, However, we would not have provided the unparseable text to vaultAdmins, so we don't allow them to save in this situation either.
member.param: The vault to save the configuration to.
The access level of the user saving the configuration.
The configuration text to save.

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.MFIdentifier.IsIDAvailable
member.summary: Indicates if there is a valid ID value available (even if it wasn't resolved). Returns true if the id has been resolved, or if the identifier was set with an id or ObjID and the id isn't considered unresolved (-1).

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.MFIdentifier.UnsafeID
member.summary: Returns an ID value if available (even if it wasn't resolved). The ID is available if it has been resolved, or if the identifier was set with an id or ObjID and the id isn't considered unresolved (-1). It is unsafe because it hasn't necessary been resolved (verified to exist) in the current vault.

member.summary: Resolves the id of a vault element by reference.
member.param: The vault in which the element is defined.
M-Files API type of the element to resolve.
Identifier can be: - int (ID of the element) - string (GUID, ID or Alias of the element) - GUID (GUID of the element) - enum (ID of the element)

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.PreviewableTextEditorAttribute.PreviewTemplate
member.summary: When both the PreviewTemplate and the PreviewSources are provided, a preview text string may be generated. This will not be applied to items that have no value. Used in combination with PreviewSources[] like, String.Format( PreviewTemplate, PreviewSources ).

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.PreviewableTextEditorAttribute.PreviewSources
member.summary: Each item in the string array will be a JSPath query string from the current item to the item for which the display value should be resolved. When both the PreviewTemplate and the PreviewSources are provided, a preview text string may be generated. This will not be applied to items that have no value. Used in combination with PreviewTemplate like, String.Format( PreviewTemplate, PreviewSources ).

member.name: P:MFiles.VAF.Configuration.PreviewableTextEditorAttribute.LoadDepth
member.summary: Provides an override depth value to be used in child item generation. Presently, the editor defaults to a default depth of a single level in preview text loading. This property allows specifying a depth.
